alert.note: Alert for Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:28PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 830 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM PST, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding is occurring along the Uvas Creek resulting in widespread flooding of Hwy 101. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gilroy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
